wikipedia_page.main: Sir Gordon Covell (20 October 1887 – 4 October 1975) was a physician and a Major in the army of British India, and a leading global expert on Malaria disease control and eradication efforts in the middle of the 20th century. He was member of the expert committee on malaria set up by the WHO from 1948 to 1958, of which he served as the secretary. At that time, he was also an advisor to the British Ministry of Health and the Director of the Malaria Laboratory at Horton Hospital.

response: *Major-General Gordon Covell, CIE, MD, BS, DPH, DTM&H, KHP, Indian Medical Service, Director, Malaria Institute of India, Delhi.
